metadata.dc:author: Rodríguez-González, Fayna
Martínez-Quintana, Efrén
metadata.dc:description: Coronary pseudoaneurysms are rare and usually occur after percutaneous procedures, spontaneous dissections, aortocoronary bypass, or chest trauma. Although most of the cases are casual, other patients present as acute myocardial infarction, fistula formation or cardiac tamponade. We report the case of a coronary pseudoaneurysm after percutaneous treatment of a coronary perforation.
metadata.dc:subject: Stent cubierto
Perforación coronaria
Seudoaneurisma
Covered stent
Pseudoaneurysms
Coronary perforation
metadata.dc:title: Seudoaneurisma coronario tras perforación coronaria tratada percutáneamente.
[Coronary pseudoaneurysm after percutaneous treatment of a coronary perforation].
metadata.dc:publisher: Clinica e investigacion en arteriosclerosis : publicacion oficial de la Sociedad Espanola de Arteriosclerosis
